noun.description: The Christian ceremony commemorating the Last Supper, in which bread and wine are consecrated and consumed.
examples: we went to an early morning Eucharist
the daily celebration of the Eucharist

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French eucariste, based on ecclesiastical Greek eukharistia thanksgiving, from Greek eukharistos grateful, from eu well + kharizesthai offer graciously (from kharis grace).
